Name: Sitting Statue of Tesen, the Son of Fifi
Description: Tesen was the son of the purifying priest, Fifi. He was a butcher in the slaughterhouse of the royal palace. The statue shows him sitting on a chair in a traditional pose. He wears a round wig with locks, a large necklace around his neck, and a short kilt that is pleated on its right side. Although the modeling of the statue is fine, the chest is not in proportion to the narrow waist.
